Reference¶

Concepts¶

Sequence

Is a collection of elements of known (at compile-time) size which provides random access to elements.

To make a type S model the Sequence concept one needs to specialise sequence_traits for this type.

View
Is a proxy that provides access into another view or sequence.

Views and Adaptors¶

struct view_base¶

Base class for all the views.

By deriving from view_base, you tell StaticView that the derived class models the View concept.

Subclassed by detail::raw_view_impl< Sequence >, view_adaptor_base< Derived, View >, view_adaptor_base< drop_impl< View >, View >

template <class Sequence>
struct sequence_traits¶

Proxy through which StaticViews functions access sequences. 

template <class Sequence> 
struct sequence_traits {
    using type = Sequence;

    static constexpr std::size_t size() noexcept;

    template <class S>
    static constexpr reference at(S&& xs, std::size_t i) noexcept;
};

struct view_adaptor_core_access¶

Helper class one can befriend to give StaticViews access to the private map function.

Defines a single private member function 

template <class View>
static constexpr auto map(View const& xs, std::size_t const i)
    noexcept( whenever possible );
that calls xs.map(i). By befriending this class, you give #boost::static_views::view_adaptor_base access to private map function, but nothing else. The very same technique is used in Boost.Iterator.

Friends

friend view_adaptor_core_access::view_adaptor_base
template <class Derived, class View>
struct view_adaptor_base¶

Base class to that helps with modeling the View concept.

Inherits from view_base

Copy and move constructors/assignments

Defines default copy and move constructors and assignments, i.e. is copy/move-constructible/assignable if View is.

constexpr view_adaptor_base(view_adaptor_base const&)¶
constexpr view_adaptor_base(view_adaptor_base&&)¶
constexpr view_adaptor_base &operator=(view_adaptor_base const&)¶
constexpr view_adaptor_base &operator=(view_adaptor_base&&)¶

Unnamed Group

Public Functions

constexpr view_adaptor_base(View &&view)¶
constexpr auto size() const¶

Default implementation of the size function required by the view concept.

Just calls size() on the underlying view.

Public Static Functions

static constexpr auto capacity()¶

Default implementation of the capacity function required by the view concept.

Just calls capacity() on the underlying view.

constexpr auto raw_view = [](auto& seq) { return detail::raw_view_impl{seq}; }¶

A functor for creating raw views of sequences.

raw_view : Sequence --> View

Raw view is the simplest view there is. It does no manipulations and is just wrapper around a sequence type to implement the View concept. It should work for any sequence for which there exists a specialisation of #boost::static_views::sequence_traits.

Details¶

template <class T>
struct detail::wrapper¶

Wraps an lvalue or an rvalue reference.

template <class Sequence>
struct detail::raw_view_impl¶

Inherits from view_base

Copy and move constructors/assignments.

Default copy and move constructors and assignment operators. They are all \( \mathcal{O}(1) \).

constexpr raw_view_impl(raw_view_impl const&)¶
constexpr raw_view_impl(raw_view_impl&&)¶
constexpr raw_view_impl &operator=(raw_view_impl const&)¶
constexpr raw_view_impl &operator=(raw_view_impl&&)¶

Public Functions

constexpr raw_view_impl(Sequence &xs)¶

Constructs a view of sequece xs.

Template Parameters
  • Sequence: Must model the sequence (TODO: link to concept definition) concept.
Parameters
  • xs: Reference to the sequence.

constexpr auto size() const¶

Returns the size of the sequence it’s viewing. 

            return sequence_traits<sequence_type>::size();
This function is required by the View concept. It’s behavior is equivalent to capacity() function, i.e. it returns the number of elements in the sequence.

See
capacity()

constexpr element_type &operator[](std::size_t const i) const¶

Element access.

This function is required by the View concept. It provides access to element at index i. Return type is determined by the corresponding specialisation of sequence_traits. It may be a reference to element, or a value, or something else. Behavior of this function is well-described by the following code snippet: 

if i < sequence.size():
    return sequence[i]
else:
    raise out_of_bound

Public Static Functions

static constexpr auto capacity()¶

Returns the size of the sequence it’s viewing. 

            return sequence_traits<sequence_type>::size();
This function is required by the View concept. It returns the maximum possible number of elements this view can have. In this case, just the number of elements in the sequence.

Note
This function is marked static constexpr and may thus be freely used in constant expressions.
See
size()

Utility functions¶

template <class T>
constexpr auto make_wrapper(T &&x)¶
template <class V>
struct is_view¶

Checks whether V models the View concept.

Metafunction that returns whether V models the View concept:

template <class View> 
struct is_view : std::is_base_of<view_base, View> 
{};

Inherits from std::is_base_of< view_base, V >
